name: UpdateTimeTrackingEntry
description:
Updates an existing time tracking entry in Asana.

Use this tool to update specific fields of an existing time tracking entry in Asana by specifying only the fields you wish to change. It helps avoid overwriting changes made by others and returns the updated record.

parameters.name: time_tracking_entry_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the time tracking entry to be updated.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the time tracking entry.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: duration_minutes_tracked
parameters.description: The time in minutes tracked by the entry. Optional field.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. Time in minutes tracked by the entry

parameters.name: entry_logged_date
parameters.description: The date the entry is logged. Defaults to today if not specified. Use format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The day that this entry is logged on. Defaults to today if no day specified

parameters.name: project_attributable_gid
parameters.description: Optional. The globally unique identifier (gid) of the project to which the time is attributable.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The gid of the project which the time is attributable to.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable formatted output for easier readability. Use mainly for debugging as it increases response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: time_tracking_entry_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the time tracking entry.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the time tracking entry.

parameters.name: data.duration_minutes
parameters.description: *Optional*. Time in minutes tracked by the entry

value_schema.description: *Optional*. Time in minutes tracked by the entry

parameters.name: data.entered_on
parameters.description: *Optional*. The day that this entry is logged on. Defaults to today if no day specified

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The day that this entry is logged on. Defaults to today if no day specified

parameters.name: data.attributable_to
parameters.description: *Optional*. The gid of the project which the time is attributable to.

value_schema.description: *Optional*. The gid of the project which the time is attributable to.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
